header.note: The source node in most cases contains the sample message as written by the developer. If it looks like a dot-delimitted string such as "form.label.firstname", then the developer has not provided a default message.

trans-unit.target: Become an archivist. With our help, learn how to import and organise documents in the media library, and create a submission folder for your students.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Import your first documents
Organise your media library
Create a submission folder
Welcome to your media library
Let's get started!

The media library stores your classroom documents: photos, videos, resources chosen on Beneylu Spot. This way, you can add content to your blog articles, messages or task notebook.

During this level, discover how to:

  • Import a document from your computer
  • Customise it
  • Make it private
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Import your first documents
Let's go!
Add, move, copy or delete your documents.

Before we get going, check out the media library

Click on the blue dots to get more information about the items in the media library.

Ready to get started? Follow me to import your first document in your classroom's folder.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Easily find the documents added to your favourites.
Open your documents. You are the only one who can see the files enclosed in this folder.
Access the classroom's folder. Students and parents can also open this file if the media library has a green light.
Select a workspace (classroom, group or partnership) to know whether there is any space left.
Access to recently imported media in the media library.
It's the basket that stores your selected documents.
Select all documents at once.
Recover deleted files and definitively empty the recycle bin to free up some storage space in the media library.
Click on your classroom's folder
To add a document for the classroom, open this folder.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Click on the button "Add" and choose "a document from the computer".

By clicking on the blue button, discover how to:

  • Create a folder
  • Import a document from your computer
  • Add a link from Internet

Let's start by adding a document from your computer.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Choose "a document from the computer"
To add a document, you can also drag and drop a file from your computer.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Thanks to the gauge, track the progress of the document loading in the media library. Your document is imported when it reaches 100%.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Downloading state of progress
You have imported your first document  !
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: By clicking on the form icon, you open it.
Rome wasn't built in a day... but you have already added one document to your media file! You can attach it to a blog article or share it with your students. Let's take a closer look.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Give it a shot!
Go back if you wish to exit a document folder or form.

>Click on the blue dots to get more information about the the form's items.

Why not customize your document ?
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Copy the selection in a folder.
Move this document in the recycle bin. The recycle bin needs to be emptied to definitively delete files and to free up some storage space in the media library.
Download document on your computer.
Rename and add a description to document.
Add this file to your favourites so you can easily find it.
Hide a file to media library users.
Rename your document.
Add a description.
Save your changes and Bob's your uncle !
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: On this form, rename the document and add a description.
On this form, change document information to rename it and add a description.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: You have customised your first document
Click on the button "Make document private"
Your document is ready for your students. Don't want to show it to them just yet ? Make the document private. A private document is only visible by the person who added it.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Click on the button "Go back" to access the classroom's folder.

The document is now private. You are the only one who can see it.
Let's see what's going on in your classroom's file.

.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Look! The document has now a padlock which means that it's private. This works for folders too.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: You have create your first private document
Organise your media library
Congratulations! You have completed level 1. How about learning how to organise your media library ? Go to level 2.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Congratulations, you have completed level 1 "Import your first documents"
Let's get started!

During this level, learn how to organise your documents in the media library. Discover how to :

  • Create a folder
  • Select documents
  • Move documents
  • Add a document as favourite
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Organise your media library
Add several documents for your students. Just got to your classroom's folder.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Click on the button "Add", then "a document from the computer".
Start by adding 3 documents.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Click on the button "Add"
Create a folder to classify these documents.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Choose "A folder in my media library"
Click on the button "Validate"
Name your new folder.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: You have created you first folder!
Let's get started

You have a brand new folder to classify your documents.

Start by selecting them.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Click on your new file

When you select a document, it goes into your selection basket on the right. This way, it can act on all these documents. We will move your 3 selected documents. To do so, choose a file in which you would like to put them.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Click on the button "Storage"
Once it's in the folder, the "Storage" button allows you to move the selected items in the folder.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Choose "Move the selection in this folder"
Once it's in the folder, the "Storage" button allows you to move the selected items in the folder.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: You have moved your first documents
Click on the document's box
Tip ! Easily find your document by adding it to your favourites. Choose a document. Add it to the selection.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Click on the button "Add selection to favourites"
We will add this document to favourites.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Click on "My favourites"
A star appears on the document. This means it has been added to your favourites. Well done !
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Continue
Tadaaa! Your document has been successfully added to the list. You are ready to continue your archivist training !
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Create a submission folder
Congratulations! You have completed level 2. How about learning how to create a submission folder for your students ? Go to level 3.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Congratulations, you have completed level 2 "Organise your media library"
Follow me!

You can now import documents in your media library and classify them into folders. To complete your archivist training, discover how to  :

  • Create a submission folder
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Create a submission folder
Click on the classroom's folder
Go to the classroom's folder
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Click on "Add the folder in my media library"

The media library invites you to create a submission folder. This folder allows students to submit definitely a document. They will no longer be able to change it or withdraw it. This can be quite handy when you need to get back a task

Add a new folder to the classroom's folder.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Add a folder to the media library
Validate creation
Click on it
The folder has been created? Great! Click on it.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Click on "Change into submission folder"

Can you see the button "Change into submission folder" in the action bar?

Click on it to to change the folder into a submission folder.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Got it

The folder is now blue. It means that it's a submission folder where your students can add a finished exercise. Each file delivered by a student will include his/her first name and date of submission.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Your adventure in the media library starts now... You have become a real archivist!
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Congratulations, you have completed the last level!

trans-unit.source: Cliquez sur le dossier de la classe
trans-unit.target: Click on the classroom's folder
